metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9050 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libxml2 20904-GITv2.9.4-16-g0741801 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in the xmlDictAddString function in dict.c. This vulnerability causes programs that use libxml2, such as PHP, to crash. This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1839.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9050` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> probably same issue as CVE-2017-9049

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3').
